------=_NextPart_001_0026_01C899B4.8B3EF0A0

Hello Margaret,

Thanks so much for the replies.  (You replied to my previo=
us email and I forgot to thank you. )

The first EVP that I received was a =
fellow saying "Peace". Before I do an EVP session I always say a prayer and=
 use the quote used in Mark Macy's book which basically says that I would l=
ike to communicate with others who would like to see others move closer to =
God in thought, word, and deed. I always add that I would like to communica=
te with those that come in Light, Love and Peace. He has said "Peace" twice=
 now. LOL.

I have my sweet wife listen to all of them also. The second EVP=
 that I got was when I asked if there were any Spirits present. A woman, wh=
o sounded like she was in the living room said "No, no Spirits." Then you c=
ould hear her walking on our hardwood floors with hard soled shoes. I figur=
ed maybe she didn't know she was a Spirit. 

The laugh wasn't sinister. It =
just caught me off of guard. I have a Jack Russell Terrier, Molly, and I wa=
s playing with her, so it's possible that the young girl was giggling at Mo=
lly or as you said maybe because she was on the tape. During this EVP Molly=
 was just a staring at the right of us. I am sure she saw them. 

Thanks fo=
r the input. I deeply appreciate it. 

Many Blessings All,

Jeremy 


From:=
 itcdeadpeople 
Sent: Tuesday, April 08, 2008 7:34 PM
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogrou=
ps.com 
Subject: [EVP-ITC] Re: Question


Hi Jeremy. Congrats on such great=
 EVP's!! It hasn't happened often, but I have heard 
laughing on both my ow=
n recordings, and that of others, but nothing there was nothing 
sinister s=
ounding. And one time, I heard what sound like a kiss.

If the giggle sound=
 was that of a young girl, maybe she was just tickled to be talking on 
the=
 recorder? If you think about it, it's very common for children to laugh an=
d be silly 
while in the physical. Makes sense they would do that in spirit=
 as well. :-)

Again, congrats on getting clear messages so quickly. At som=
e point, you'll want to make 
sure others can hear some of them too. It's n=
ot uncommon for something to be heard 
absolutely clearly by the person doi=
ng the recording but not heard clearly (or even heard 
at all) by others. I=
 never really know how clear what I have might be until I get feedback 
fro=
m others. It's my opinion that doing EVP work can definitely increase one's=
 
clairaudience. 

Margaret

--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "Jeremy Robert=
 Huber" <JeremyRobertHuber@...> 
wrote:
>
> Hello Everyone,
> 
> I am relat=
ively new to this group. I have been studying about ITC
> research and EVP'=
s for some time. I started doing EVP's with my Sony
> tape recorder about t=
hree weeks ago. So far, I have gotten many Class
> A EVP's.
> 
> On Sunday,=
 I did my recording from my bedroom. I am disabled and was
> in quite a bit=
 of pain that evening. I just listened to the tape a few
> minutes ago and =
was astounded. I can hear a good friend of mine, Jean,
> that passed in 199=
1, calling my name as clear as a bell. Then someone
> else, whispers my nam=
e loudly into the tape recorder. After that you
> can hear a young girl gig=
gle. I think it was her that whispered into
> the tape recorder. 
> 
> I ha=
d tears of joy realizing that my good friend is trying to contact me. 
> 
>=
 Has anyone else had Spirits laugh or giggle on an EVP. That part kind
> of=
 made me nervous.
> 
> Thanks everyone,
> 
> Jeremy
> New York, New York
>
=

n hear some of them too. It's not uncommon for something to be heard

have

oing EVP
